channel.title: devAny - Coding with editor, terminal and browser on iPhone/iPad on devAny
channel.description: Recent content in devAny - Coding with editor, terminal and browser on iPhone/iPad on devAny

item.title: Getting started
item.description: Installation on Server The connection of this setup is NOT encrypted. Secure connection is highly recommended. Please follow secure connection after the below instruction is completed. We provide docker(*1) image so that all processes for devAny is up and runing. Please install docker by following docker installation After docker is installed, you just run the following command. $ sudo docker run -d -h devany \ -v /home/devany:/home/<USERNAME> -e HOME=/home/<USERNAME> -e USERNAME=<USERNAME> -e PASSWORD=<YOUR PASSWORD> \ -p 8888:8888 -p 3000:5000 shohey1226/devany:latest Please set your <USERNAME> and <YOUR PASSWORD>.

item.title: How to use terminal
item.description: Terminal is a terminal session to connect to server. You can use screen/tmux to keep sessions in the background because when devAny app is inacitve(open the other app, for example), it cuts the sesesson. devany command devany command is available and this command opens file or link to Editor and Browser respectively. Open file with Editor from Terminal $ devany -f content/how-to-use/index.md Open link with Browser from Terminal $ devany -l https://www.

item.title: How to use devAny
item.description: Desktop Desktop view has terminal, editor and browser. This can be seen by making your device horizontal(landscape). The below shortcuts is always available in Desktop. Move Window : Cmd+Tab You can see green line on the edge. The window which has green line is the active window. You can change the active window with this shortcut. (Also you can tap on device to make active) Full screen : Cmd+Shift+?

item.title: How to use editor
item.description: Save file: Cmd+s Change file: Control+Tab Close file: Cmd+w Copy: Cmd+c Paste: Cmd+v Other keybindings: There are tons of keybindings on Editor. The below is the list.

item.title: web browsing
item.description: Open link from Terminal $ devany -l https://stackoverflow.com Links Google Stackoverflow Github Slack Linuxbrew rbenv

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: Last updated: Jan 2, 2018 Waza Lab built the devAny app as a Commercial app. This SERVICE is provided by Waza Lab and is intended for use as is. This page is used to inform website visitors regarding our policies with the collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information if anyone decided to use our Service. If you choose to use our Service, then you agree to the collection and use of information in relation to this policy.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: My terminal is always blank and not responding? You need to set up your server. Please go through getting started.

item.title: How to use browser
item.description: Browser is for browsing websites. You can operate with only your keyboard. Apple doesn’t allow us to go insecure website(http) and only allow secure(SSL/TSL) enabled websites. devAny tries to get insecure websites through server but it doesn’t work 100%. Shortcuts Keyboard Command Description Command + i Open links Command + c Copy Command + v Paste Command + r Reload Control + p Scroll up Control + n Scroll down Command + [ Go back Command + ] Go forward

item.title: Terms & Conditions
item.description: By downloading or using the app, these terms will automatically apply to you – you should make sure therefore that you read them carefully before using the app. You’re not allowed to copy, or modify the app, any part of the app, or our trademarks in any way. You’re not allowed to attempt to extract the source code of the app, and you also shouldn’t try to translate the app into other languages, or make derivative versions.
